intro: Rondeletia brauseana, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
